teaser: As the sequester nears, stock markets seem not to notice. Can Groupon revive the daily deal? And, Internet service providers try out a new 'six strikes' rule to curb online piracy.
contentencoded:
Two days away from the sequester, the Dow is pretty much right where it was a month ago. Why is Wall Street seemingly unfazed by Washington's latest fiscal deadline?

Can Groupon revive the daily deal and itself? As the company reports fourth quarter earnings, its new business model will be in the spotlight.

And Internet service providers are rolling out a "six strikes" policy to educate rather than punish people for illegal downloads.
title: PODCAST: Wall Street plays it cool, a six strike rule
description: As the sequester nears, stock markets seem not to notice. Can Groupon revive the daily deal? And, Internet service providers try out a new 'six strikes' rule to curb online piracy.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, February 27, 2013
